body: I can take a look at this issue. Can someone assign it to me?
@Ahmedn1 This should be fixed in MLflow 1.2; can you try logging metrics using version 1.2 and let me know if this persists?
@dbczumar Nope, I upgraded to 1.2 and it didn't fix the problem.

I have a fresh reinstalled MLflow, and cannot reproduce the error. Here is a screenshot of running 
```
import mlflow
mlflow.log_metrics('x', 0.1)
mlflow.log_metrics('x', 0.2)
mlflow.log_metrics('x', 0.3)
mlflow.log_metrics('x', 0.4)
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12961341/64079877-32c43b00-cca2-11e9-9fbc-db1a23f18d84.png)

@Ahmedn1 Can you provide the exact code you used to produce the error and show us a screenshot of the wrong timestamp

@ustcscgyer 
```
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
mlflow_client = MlflowClient(MLFLOW_URI)
r = mlflow_client.create_run('2')
mlflow_client.log_metric(r.info.run_id, 'M1', 1)
mlflow_client.log_metric(r.info.run_id, 'M1', 15)
mlflow_client.log_metric(r.info.run_id, 'M1', 100)
```

![Screenshot from 2019-09-02 01-55-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4731542/64083808-3fd63e00-cd25-11e9-854c-162ddafc8eb6.png)
Error reproduced. Trying to identify the issue.
Found the problem. The `mlflow.log_metrics`(fluent)  uses milliseconds, but `mlflow_client.log_metrics` (client) uses seconds as the timestamp. I will create a PR to fix this.
@Ahmedn1 Issues should be fixed by this PR: #1804

@ustcscgyer Great. I hope this will be pushed into a release soon. 
Thank you

@Ahmedn1 This issue should be resolved.
@dbczumar I cannot close this issue. Can you please tell me how I can gain permission to do so?
